Articles.Content:
Can someone give me a link to the Unity to use with KSP, it has been ages since I have used it and I want to work on some IVA prop stuff. 

Thanks!

I think I found one, is KSP using 4.6.5? That's the lastest I found for Unity 4.
KSP is using Unity 4.6.4f1 which can be found [here](https://unity3d.com/get-unity/download/archive).

I believe the best version to use for making KSP mods is 4.2.2 I'm actually not sure which version KSP currently uses, but all sub-versions of Unity 4 are available for download.

[**Link to the Unity Download Archives**](http://unity3d.com/get-unity/download/archive)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-03T00:47:23Z" title="05/03/2015 12:47  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 3, 2015</time> by OrbitusII**
The first line of [path]\Kerbal Space Program\KSP\_Data\output\_log.txt always shows the Unity version in use ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> The first line of [path]\Kerbal Space Program\KSP\_Data\output\_log.txt always shows the Unity version in use ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Good to know, thanks! I've been away from the game for too long...

For using Unity and Part tools for making parts, you should probably stick to 4.2.2, since that is the optimal version for Part tools (the updated animation system in Unity after this makes it harder to use it for KSP) - this is according to Mu as of a few days ago still I believe.
